intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides subvar. ramosum, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white to pale blue, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
